content:
• Friday, August 19, 2011
  • LEAF

    After a brief bounce earlier this week on reports that one of its directors had bought shares,...

    After a brief bounce earlier this week on reports that one of its directors had bought shares, Demand Media (DMD) reversed course and resumed its downward trajectory, losing another -9.8% today. The stock has shed 68% of its value since its late-January IPO.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • BAS

    Basic Energy Services (NYSE:BAS) takes a hit today, closing -10% on reports of insider selling....

    Basic Energy Services (NYSE:BAS) takes a hit today, closing -10% on reports of insider selling. (I, II).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • LDK

    Solar stocks fall hard yet again after a guidance cut from LDK Solar (LDK -23%), and a DigiTimes...

    Solar stocks fall hard yet again after a guidance cut from LDK Solar (LDK -23%), and a DigiTimes report about rising inventory backlogs. STP -8.8%. HSOL -8.6%. JASO -4.7%. FSLR  -6.4%. TSL -4.3%. SPWRA -6%. CSIQ -5.9%. Yingli Green Energy (YGE -6.6%), whose Q2 results beat forecasts, also fell.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (NASDAQ:SGEN) gains another +2% in after-hours trading, now up nearly +9% since...

    Seattle Genetics (NASDAQ:SGEN) gains another +2% in after-hours trading, now up nearly +9% since the FDA announcement.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • SGNT

    Sagent Pharmaceuticals (SGNT +4%) closed higher today after announcing the launch of its...

    Sagent Pharmaceuticals (SGNT +4%) closed higher today after announcing the launch of its neuromuscular blocking agent vecuronium bromide - which is currently in short supply in the U.S. - for injection in 10 and 20 mg single-use vials.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • NEM

    Gold mining stocks were lifted today on the back of record prices for the yellow metal: Newmont...

    Gold mining stocks were lifted today on the back of record prices for the yellow metal: Newmont Mining (NEM +2.8%), Royal Gold (RGLD +2.6%), Jaguar Mining (JAG +6.7%), Great Basin Gold (GBG +8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • VECO

    Veeco Instruments (VECO +2.6%) holds on to its gains at the close, after being initiated with a...

    Veeco Instruments (VECO +2.6%) holds on to its gains at the close, after being initiated with a buy on valuation earlier today at Ticonderoga.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • MCD

    Healthcare companies and low-end restaurant chains are performing relatively well today, are...

    Healthcare companies and low-end restaurant chains are performing relatively well today, are investors pare risk and look for "recession-proof" names. MCD +2.1%.  MRK +1.1%. YUM +1.3%. ABT +0.9%. STJ +1%. BSX +1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • WDC

    Western Digital's (WDC -5.1%) proposed acquisition of Hitachi's (HIT -1.8%) hard-disk drive...

    Western Digital's (WDC -5.1%) proposed acquisition of Hitachi's (HIT -1.8%) hard-disk drive business may not be going as smoothly as hoped, as the company discloses in an SEC filing that the European Commission issued a "statement of objections" related to the deal and the effect it would have on competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • MGM

    It's now a two-day steep selloff for MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) after Kirk Kerkorian decided to...

    It's now a two-day steep selloff for MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) after Kirk Kerkorian decided to unload 20M shares. Shares were down 13% yesterday and trade 6.2% lower today, stinging Kerkorian's remaining 23% stake in the casino operator along with the rest of investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • GM

    General Motors (NYSE:GM) falls 7.4% after reports (I, II) cutting estimates on domestic and...

    General Motors (NYSE:GM) falls 7.4% after reports (I, II) cutting estimates on domestic and global car sales start to filter around. Yesterday, Barclays trimmed its PT on shares to $38 from $40.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN +3.1%) shares spike after confirming FDA approval of its Adcetris...

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN +3.1%) shares spike after confirming FDA approval of its Adcetris lymphoma drug and establishing a program offering access to reimbursement support, benefit investigations and patient assistance related to the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP +2.7%) enters into an agreement with William Ackerman's Pershing Capital that...

    J.C. Penney (JCP +2.7%) enters into an agreement with William Ackerman's Pershing Capital that allows the stakeholder to increase its position in the firm to 26.1%, from 16.5%. The deal stipulates the investment firm cannot transfer shares to any investor if it brings their position to over 10%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • ADSK

    Despite a decent Q2 earnings report after the close yesterday, Autodesk (ADSK -10.4%) gets...

    Despite a decent Q2 earnings report after the close yesterday, Autodesk (ADSK -10.4%) gets hammered along a weak tech sector. Aggravating matters are cautious comments Citi is making suggesting a potential slowdown in the company's European business.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • SIX

    Shares of Six Flags (SIX +2.6%) get a boost with an upgrade from Miller Tabak to Buy from Hold,...

    Shares of Six Flags (SIX +2.6%) get a boost with an upgrade from Miller Tabak to Buy from Hold, and a PT of $42. The firm exited bankruptcy 15 months ago after getting buried by a high debt load and lagging attendance at its parks.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • VIT

    After a brief respite, VanceInfo (VIT -7.7%) continues its downward march following a terrible...

    After a brief respite, VanceInfo (VIT -7.7%) continues its downward march following a terrible earnings report on Tuesday. The stock has broken through a another 52-week low, and nears a two-year bottom.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • MSFT

    Nomura analyst Richard Windsor speculates Microsoft (MSFT -2.2%) and Oracle (ORCL -1.1%) are two...

    Nomura analyst Richard Windsor speculates Microsoft (MSFT -2.2%) and Oracle (ORCL -1.1%) are two cash-rich tech giants standing ready to bid for Autonomy following H-P's (HPQ well-publicized offer, potentially pushing up the price tag.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -15.7%) crater on 3x normal trading volume after last night's...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -15.7%) crater on 3x normal trading volume after last night's announcement that Liberty Media (LCAPA -1.4%) will take a stake in the embattled bookseller's preferred stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • SKS

    Saks (SKS +3.8%) is higher today after S&P raises its junk-level credit rating on the luxury...

    Saks (SKS +3.8%) is higher today after S&P raises its junk-level credit rating on the luxury retailer to BB, saying YTD performance has been impressive and it expects "moderate operational gains" over the near-term.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • HPQ

    It appears that Todd Bradley and Jon Rubinstein were both ambushed by CEO Léo Apotheker...

    It appears that Todd Bradley and Jon Rubinstein were both ambushed by CEO Léo Apotheker and H-P's abandonment of its Personal Systems Group. Now that the decision has been made to stop selling webOS-based hardware, questions are swirling around whether the two will even want to remain to take over any potential spinoff. HPQ -20%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • AXL

    American Axle (NYSE:AXL) is down another -4% today - having lost nearly 16% over the past three...

    American Axle (NYSE:AXL) is down another -4% today - having lost nearly 16% over the past three trading sessions - as a union strike closes its last plant in the Buffalo, NY area, cutting about 90 jobs.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • LOPE

    Grand Canyon Education (LOPE +4.3%) gains after Wunderlich initiates the shares with a buy on...

    Grand Canyon Education (LOPE +4.3%) gains after Wunderlich initiates the shares with a buy on valuation. The firm says its strong brand, attractive campus, and Division II sports make it an viable alternative to Arizona State.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • KIRK

    Kirkland's (KIRK +6%) stages a stunning turnaround after dropping -11% at the opening on a weak...

    Kirkland's (KIRK +6%) stages a stunning turnaround after dropping -11% at the opening on a weak Q2 earnings report. The specialty retailer missed on all levels as sales and margins deteriorated, but the stock has since rallied on the announcement of a $40M share buyback.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMRS

    Amyris (AMRS +6.5%) trades higher after announcing earlier today that it signed a multi-year...

    Amyris (AMRS +6.5%) trades higher after announcing earlier today that it signed a multi-year supply agreement with Japanese specialty chemical manufacturer Nikko Chemicals for several hundred tons of it's renewable squalane.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • FL

    Shares of Foot Locker (FL +4.4%) post a solid gain after reporting Q2 earnings after the bell...

    Shares of Foot Locker (FL +4.4%) post a solid gain after reporting Q2 earnings after the bell yesterday. Shoe sellers DECK +2.5%, PSS +2.4% and SKX +1.9% are also rallying today on FL's improved revenue outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • RTW

    Women's apparel retailer New York & Co. (NWY) falls 16.9% after reporting Q2 revenue of...

    Women's apparel retailer New York & Co. (NWY) falls 16.9% after reporting Q2 revenue of $228.6M (-6% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.15; the latter was in-line, but the former missed consensus by $7.8M. Same-store sales declined 3.4%. The company expects a slight decline in same-store sales in Q3, and to operate 35 fewer stores than in Q3 2010.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • AAUKY

    Anglo American PLC (OTCPK:AAUKY -1.1%) may be mulling a competitive bid for Australian miner...

    Anglo American PLC (OTCPK:AAUKY -1.1%) may be mulling a competitive bid for Australian miner Macarthur Coal (OTC:MACDY +8.2%) that would challenge a joint $4.9B offer already on the table from Peabody Energy (BTU -0.3%) and ArcelorMittal (MT -1.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • WTSL

    Teen apparel retailer Wet Seal (WTSLA +12.2%) pops after reporting Q2 profits rose 38% on strong...

    Teen apparel retailer Wet Seal (WTSLA +12.2%) pops after reporting Q2 profits rose 38% on strong sales and better gross margins. The company also raises its Q3 guidance, now expecting an EPS fo $0.05 to $0.06 on net sales of $159M to $161M, above consensus expectations for an EPS of $0.04 on revenues of $161M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • ANN

    AnnTaylor (ANN +12.8%) shows strong gains after knocking out an earnings beat, and updating its...

    AnnTaylor (ANN +12.8%) shows strong gains after knocking out an earnings beat, and updating its outlook. The retailer sees comparable sales to increase in the mid-single digits for FY11, supported by strong performance in e-commerce and factory channels.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • NEWN

    New Energy Systems (OTC:NEWN -5%) is down this morning after Paul Li, who was scheduled to...

    New Energy Systems (OTC:NEWN -5%) is down this morning after Paul Li, who was scheduled to become the new CFO on August 16, decides not to join the company due to personal reasons. The company's current CFO will continue to serve in the interim until a permanent replacement is secured.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD +5.2%) is recouping some of this week's losses, as investors view H-P's (HPQ...

    Dell (DELL-OLD +5.2%) is recouping some of this week's losses, as investors view H-P's (HPQ -20.4%) planned PC exit as a positive for the world's #2 PC maker. But Ticonderoga's Brian White is still initiating coverage with a Sell, believing Dell's exposure to weak government and consumer spending offsets promising enterprise initiatives. (DELL FQ2)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM

  • Gold futures pushed to new session highs of $1881.40/oz. overnight, but have pulled back ~$34;...

    Gold futures pushed to new session highs of $1881.40/oz. overnight, but have pulled back ~$34; now at $1846, +1.3%. The yellow metal's recent run sparks talk of $2,000: "I think we're going to see it by the end of this month," MF Global's Adam Klopfenstein exudes. "People gravitate towards [assets] that give them piece of mind when there's a lot of uncertainty."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 5 Comments
  • OPLK

    Despite a 12% jump in FQ4 earnings, shares of Oplink Communications (OPLK -7.4%) are trading...

    Despite a 12% jump in FQ4 earnings, shares of Oplink Communications (OPLK -7.4%) are trading lower after forecasting a downbeat FQ1. The company now sees revenue between $41M and $44M and an EPS of around $0.12 to $0.18, far below the consensus view for an EPS of $0.28 on sales of $47M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • INTU

    Shares of Intuit (INTU +12.1%) pop after the firm delivered its Q2 report yesterday. The firm...

    Shares of Intuit (INTU +12.1%) pop after the firm delivered its Q2 report yesterday. The firm says segment growth is strong, and it's adapting its strategy by converting business customers away from software dependence to online and cloud service buyers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM

  • The first shades of green pop through in Europe, with France and the U.K. now slightly positive...

    The first shades of green pop through in Europe, with France and the U.K. now slightly positive on the day. Stoxx 50 -0.6%. Germany -0.7% now, had been down 4.5% earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • LUV

    Major airline stocks are showing signs of life after an extended beatdown, as a recipe of lower...

    Major airline stocks are showing signs of life after an extended beatdown, as a recipe of lower fuel prices and steady air fares looks to benefit carriers. Gainers: LUV +2.4%, UAL +2.8%, DAL +3%, LCC +2.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • HPQ

    Six analysts are downgrading H-P (HPQ -22.2%) following yesterday's soft guidance and stunning...

    Six analysts are downgrading H-P (HPQ -22.2%) following yesterday's soft guidance and stunning announcements. Needham (Underperform) think "HP may have eroded ... Wall Street's confidence in the company;" and Sterne Agee (Neutral) thinks the PC division could be sold at a depressed valuation, and that its sale could hurt bundling opportunities. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 3 Comments
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +38%) spikes higher on a report Sprint (NYSE:S) is fixing to buy the rest of the...

    Clearwire (CLWR +38%) spikes higher on a report Sprint (NYSE:S) is fixing to buy the rest of the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • CRM

    Salesforce CRM soars 7.1% higher in trading, even after taking on a slew of PT cuts from...

    Salesforce CRM soars 7.1% higher in trading, even after taking on a slew of PT cuts from analysts including UBS, Susquehana, JPMorgan and Jefferies. The firm's CEO outlined a host of new business in the pipeline - including a few "mega-deals" - in a CC yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • LYG

    Banking shares are taking another big hit in Europe today. Lloyd's LYG -5%, Royal Bank of...

    Banking shares are taking another big hit in Europe today. Lloyd's LYG -5%, Royal Bank of Scotland RBS -5%, Banco Santander STD -5%, Barclays BCS -3%, Unicredit -4.3%, SocGen OTCPK:SCGLY -2.7%. Escaping the carnage, UBS and CS, both flat premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • BB

    Shares of Research in Motion (RIMM) are up 3% premarket as talk about the value of the firm as...

    Shares of Research in Motion (RIMM) are up 3% premarket as talk about the value of the firm as an acquisition swirls around. Morgan Keegan values RIMM at $25B, a hefty 85% premium to the market cap shares trade at currently.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • S

    Premarket gainers: CLWR +19%. MRVL +7%. YGE +4%. SODA +5%. IRE +3%. ARMH +3%. RIMM +3%. HL +3%....

    Premarket gainers: CLWR +19%. MRVL +7%. YGE +4%. SODA +5%. IRE +3%. ARMH +3%. RIMM +3%. HL +3%. EK +3%. CRM +3%.
    Losers: LDK -21%. HPQ -18%. LYG -5%. STD -5%. SPPI -5%. RBS -5%. TI -3%. IDCC -4%. CCL -4%. DNDN -4%. S -3%. LVS -3%. DB -3%. C -3%. ANR -5%. RF -3%. SIRI -3%. BAC -3%. BCS -3%. F -3%. MCP -2%. RDS.A -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM

  • In addition to the rally in European shares, the dollar all of a sudden gets hammered. Given the...

    In addition to the rally in European shares, the dollar all of a sudden gets hammered. Given the "V"-shaped moves (i, ii), something is up. One wag mentions rumors of an emergency Fed meeting.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM | 5 Comments
  • CRM

    Shares of Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) are now up 5.5% after recording a Q2 earnings beat yesterday and...

    Shares of Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) are now up 5.5% after recording a Q2 earnings beat yesterday and posting an AH gain. JPMorgan trims it PT on shares to $130 from $140, saying the firm is better-positioned than peers - but fairly valued.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM
  • HPQ

    Hewlett-Packard (NYSE:HPQ) is cut to neutral at UBS, with price target of $29. Shares continue...

    Hewlett-Packard (NYSE:HPQ) is cut to neutral at UBS, with price target of $29. Shares continue to sink, -14% premarket to $25.42. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM

  • Crude oil continues down, falling briefly below the $80 level before bouncing back. WTI crude...

    Crude oil continues down, falling briefly below the $80 level before bouncing back. WTI crude now -2.8% at $80.11.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM
  • GLD

    Gold continues sharply higher, +2.9% to $1,874/oz. as Asia closes on the lows and the...

    Gold continues sharply higher, +2.9% to $1,874/oz. as Asia closes on the lows and the liquidation of European shares resumes. GLD +2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 AM
  • BCS

    Banks are taking another pasting in European trading: Barclays (NYSE:BCS) -6%, RBS -3.7%, Lloyds...

    Banks are taking another pasting in European trading: Barclays (NYSE:BCS) -6%, RBS -3.7%, Lloyds (NYSE:LYG) -6%, SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY) -3.4%, Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB) -3.2%, and UniCredit (OTC:UNCIF) -5.3%. HSBC (HBC) is in the green at +0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 AM

  • European stocks continue declines from yesterday on global growth concerns. Stoxx 50 -2%, London...

    European stocks continue declines from yesterday on global growth concerns. Stoxx 50 -2%, London -1.4%, Paris -2%, and Frankfurt -1.4%. In Asia, Japan -2.5%, Hong Kong -2.6%, China -1.0%, India -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 AM
